definition: neither giving way to the other
mutual
(negative prefix)/not/no
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])

sentences.english: Two people you to me to, are eyeball.
sentences.chinese: 二人你来我往，互不相让。

sentences.english: Now her anger was as hot as mine. We stood on equal ground.
sentences.chinese: 现在她和我一样横眉怒目，互不相让。

sentences.english: The two horses were neck and neck all the way down to the wire.
sentences.chinese: 一直到终点两匹马都并驾齐驱，互不相让。

sentences.english: Mothers are each other's nemeses, bickering among ourselves about our own particular style.
sentences.chinese: 母亲们互不相让，针对自己独特的教子风格争论不休。

sentences.english: Stand at a draught two, and each other does not let , whose referee should listen to?
sentences.chinese: 一下子站出两位，且互不相让，该听谁裁判呢？

sentences.english: Neither snipe nor clam would yield, and they remained in that position for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 鹬鸟和河蚌互不相让，死死地纠缠在一起。

definition: at a stalemate/deadlocked/in unrelenting mutual opposition
sharply opposed to each other, with neither prepared to give an inch (idiom)
each sticks to his own view (idiom); a dialogue of the deaf
to be awfully (busy etc)
evenly matched (idiom)
each sticks to his own opinion (idiom); chacun son gout
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
lit. with swords drawn and bows bent (idiom); fig. a state of mutual hostility/at daggers drawn
war of words
to dispute/to disagree/to argue opinionatedly/to wrangle
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
lit. you fight, I snatch (idiom); to compete fiercely offering no quarter/fierce rivalry/tug-of-war
both sides (in contract)/the two opposing sides (in a dispute)
to be deadlocked
wrestling/a trial of strength
each sticks to his own version (idiom); a dialogue of the deaf
